flounder.loaders

Class Loader

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.loaders.Loader

  • public class Loader
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains a lot of methods for VAO and VBO data management, and also keeps track of all currently active VAOs and VBOs.

      Loader()

    • Method Detail

      • storeDataInVBO

        public static int storeDataInVBO(int vaoID,
                                 float[] data,
                                 int attributeNumber,
                                 int coordSize)

      • createInterleavedVAO

        public static int createInterleavedVAO(float[] data,
                                       int... lengths)
        Loads interleaved vertex data into a VBO which is stored in a newly created VAO (without index buffer).
        Parameters:
        data - The vertex data.
        lengths - The length (number of floats) of each data element. E.g. Data for positions, normals and texture coords may have lengths of 3, 3, 2.
        Returns:
        The ID of the new VAO.

      • createVAO

        public static int createVAO()
        Creates an empty VAO.
        Returns:
        The ID of the VAO.

      • storeInterleavedDataInVAO

        public static void storeInterleavedDataInVAO(int vaoID,
                                             float[] data,
                                             int... lengths)
        Stores interleaved data into a VAO.
        Parameters:
        vaoID - The ID of the VAO.
        data - The interleaved float data.
        lengths - The lengths in floats of each of the data elements associated with any given vertex.

      • createEmptyVBO

        public static int createEmptyVBO(int floatCount)

      • addInstancedAttribute

        public static void addInstancedAttribute(int vao,
                                         int vbo,
                                         int attribute,
                                         int dataSize,
                                         int instancedDataLength,
                                         int offset)

      • updateVBO

        public static void updateVBO(int vbo,
                             float[] data,
                             java.nio.FloatBuffer buffer)

      • createInterleavedVAO

        public static int createInterleavedVAO(int vertexCount,
                                       float[]... data)
        Creates a VAO, interleaves the data, and stores it in the VAO. No index buffer is associated with the VAO.
        Parameters:
        vertexCount - The number of vertices whose data is being stored.
        data - The various sets of data (positions, normals, texture coords, etc.)
        Returns:
        The newly created VAO.

      • interleaveFloatData

        public static float[] interleaveFloatData(int count,
                                          float[]... data)
        Interleaved multiple float arrays of data into one interleaved float array.
        Parameters:
        count - The number of data elements (not floats) in the arrays.
        data - The arrays of un-interleaved data.
        Returns:
        The interleaved data.

      • createIndicesVBO

        public static int createIndicesVBO(int vaoID,
                                   int[] indices)
        Creates an index buffer and binds it to a VAO.
        Parameters:
        vaoID - The ID of the VAO to which the index buffer should be bound.
        indices - The array of indices to be stored in the index buffer.
        Returns:
        The ID of the index buffer VBO.

      • createEmptyInterleavedVBO

        public static int createEmptyInterleavedVBO(int vaoID,
                                            int maxVertexCount,
                                            int startingAttribute,
                                            int... lengths)
        Creates an empty VBO for storing interleaved data and links it with the attribute lists of a VAO.
        Parameters:
        vaoID - The ID of the VAO to which the VBO should be added.
        maxVertexCount - The maximum number of vertices that would need to be stored in the VBO.
        startingAttribute - The first available attribute list of the VAO.
        lengths - The lengths in floats of each of the data elements associated with any given vertex.
        Returns:
        The ID of the newly created VBO.

      • storeDataInVBO

        public static void storeDataInVBO(int vbo,
                                  java.nio.FloatBuffer buffer,
                                  float[] data,
                                  int startIndex)
        Store float data into part of a VBO. Can be used for updating data in a VBO.
        Parameters:
        vbo - The ID of the VBO.
        buffer - A float buffer that can be used to store the data in the VBO. Must be bigger than data.length.
        data - The float data to be stored in the VBO.
        startIndex - The starting index in terms of floats for where the data should be stored in the VBO.

      • refillVBOWithData

        public static void refillVBOWithData(int vbo,
                                     java.nio.FloatBuffer buffer,
                                     float[] data)
        Refills an entire VBO with new data.
        Parameters:
        vbo - The ID of the VBO.
        buffer - A float buffer big enough to contain the data.
        data - The data to be stored in the VBO.

      • deleteVAOFromCache

        public static void deleteVAOFromCache(int vao)
        Deletes a VAO from memory along with any associated VBOs.
        Parameters:
        vao - The vao to be deleted.

      • dispose

        public static void dispose()
        Deletes all the VBOs and VAOs that are currently stored.
